messageBody:
On 2002-09-17 at 19:41 oliveoylslo wrote:

>I was wondering if anyone had a complete Junit test to test your EJB
>that I could look at. I'm new at Junit and just finished testing my
>Dao and wanted to see how other people test their Ejb. I have an Ejb
>that has almost no business logic and essentially just gives you
>connections.

...then why do you want to test it with JUnit? Since you're new to
JUnit, I assume you're also new to unit testing in general. I suggest
that you don't want to test an EJB that has no business logic if you
have already tested the DAO underneath.

If you *do* have business logic, then I suggest refactoring that into
its own class (collaborating with the DAO directly, I imagine) and
testing *that*, since that allows you to avoid issues about testing
with EJB containers and so on.

But don't test the EJB code -- the stuff that's part of the EJB
framework -- unless you're trying to reproduce a defect. It's enough
work to test your own code without trying to test everyone else's.

Good luck.
